page.title: 03YARWELL VILLAGE
page.content: Yarwell is a small picturesque village beside the River Nene. It has many old houses made from local stone and Collyweston slate. In the centre of the village is one public house, called The Angel, which is 500 years old but still in good condition. There is a post office which serves as a general store as well. The houses are often generous in size, and in a variety of styles, terraced, detatched and semi_detached, as well as the attractive stone cottages typical of this area. Although the village is small it has a lively and active community, and there are several facilities which serve the villagers; the village hall is a centre for these activities, ranging from regular playgroups and discos for the young, to day trips for the old.
